parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post mentions PSD and PNL, it does not refer to specific candidates by name or surname.  The analysis focuses on the political system and institutions (CCR, BEC, CSAT), not individual candidates.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is published on a public Facebook page ("Comunitatea Liberală 1848") and is a paid advertisement, clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective is debatable. While it discusses the political climate and institutions in the context of upcoming elections, it doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against any specific candidate. The analysis of the political situation could be interpreted as aiming to influence public opinion, but it doesn't directly advocate for a particular electoral outcome.  The argument presented is more of a political commentary than a direct call to action for a specific candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents itself as a political commentary or analysis, similar to an opinion piece in a newspaper. It raises questions about the political situation and offers interpretations, but it doesn't necessarily adhere to strict journalistic standards of objectivity and neutrality. However, it's not overtly biased towards a specific candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post presents an opinionated analysis of the political situation. While it expresses strong views, it doesn't directly advocate for or against any specific candidate. The language used is strong, but the overall intent seems to be to stimulate discussion and analysis rather than to directly influence voting behavior.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>992810739531453</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing the political climate and mentioning parties (PSD and PNL) involved in the upcoming elections, does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate. It presents a political analysis and commentary, raising questions about the state of democracy and the influence of certain institutions.  While the timing (two days before the election) is close to the voting period, the content itself doesn't explicitly promote or discourage voting for any particular candidate.  The analysis is opinionated, but it doesn't cross the line into direct electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The lack of a direct call to action for a specific candidate is a key factor in this assessment.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Comunitatea Liberală 1848</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
